sense.name: excerpts or passages of works restated verbatim
sense.examples: He read a great quotation from Mark Twain. Her grandfather often gave quotations from the Old Testament. Here is a direct quotation from the article.

sense.name: citation or reference to a selected excerpt of a work
sense.commentary: QUOTATION[+entity][+symbolic][+notation][+citation] Note: notation used to indicate references to source material
sense.examples: The quotations listed for these studies were not accurate or complete. Use quotation marks to indicate when a character is speaking in a novel.

sense.name: a statement of the current price of a stock or other financial instrument
sense.examples: This web site gives stock quotations with a 15-minute delay. John scanned the quotations for various currencies in the business section of the paper.

sense.name: a formal statement of cost estimate, e.g., contractor
sense.examples: The contractor said he will give us a quotation tomorrow. We chose the painting company that gave us the next-to-lowest quotation for painting our house.

sense.name: the act of referencing or citing something/someone
sense.commentary: QUOTATION[+action][+communication][+referencing][+source] Note: refers to a speaker's act of quoting, rather than the excerpt itself (Sense 1)
sense.examples: There was much quotation of Darwin during their debate. Bob often resorts to quotation rather than offering his own original thoughts.
